subject: Sleep
title: Racing Thoughts at Bedtime
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Racing Thoughts at Bedtime.

hook.text: The lights are off and suddenly every unfinished task, past mistake, and future worry arrives at once.

buildup.text: During the day, external stimulation occupies the brain. At bedtime, the default mode network activates.

discovery.text: The default mode network is responsible for self-referential thinking, mind-wandering, and rumination.

twist.text: Anxious brains have an overactive default mode network that floods consciousness with worries when external input stops.

climax.text: Techniques like cognitive shuffling or body scanning redirect the default network away from worry loops.

punchline.text: Your brain doesn't race at bedtime. It finally has quiet enough to hear itself.

quiz.question: What brain network drives racing thoughts at bedtime?
